GOD.content: European history gets lost in details, doesn’t think abyss at heart of history that prevents totalization, misunderstands link btwn historicity & responsibility
GOD.linkedContent: European history gets lost in details, doesn’t think abyss at heart of history that prevents totalization, misunderstands link btwn historicity & responsibility

GOD.content: via Patočka, 2 heterogenous secrets: 1) secret of historicity 2) secret of orgiastic mystery which history of responsibility has to break w/
GOD.linkedContent: via Patočka, 2 heterogenous secrets: 1) secret of historicity 2) secret of orgiastic mystery which history of responsibility has to break w/

R.content: messianicity that at once interrupts and accomplishes intrinsic historicity [re: concept of democracy]
R.linkedContent: messianicity that at once interrupts and accomplishes intrinsic historicity [re: concept of democracy]

OOG.content: for phenomenology, irreducible historicity is only recognized after the event [re: phrasing of “in which it must have appeared,” necessity of Quod and Quomodo]
OOG.linkedContent: for phenomenology, irreducible historicity is only recognized after the event [re: phrasing of “in which it must have appeared,” necessity of Quod and Quomodo]

OOG.content: for phenomenology, conditions of objectivity are conditions of historicity.

Husserl reveals the univocity Joyce doesn’t: the apriori and the teleological condition for all historicity; that without which equivocations of empirical culture and history are possible [an impossible that makes Possible?]
OOG.linkedContent: Husserl reveals the univocity Joyce doesn’t: the apriori and the teleological condition for all historicity; that without which equivocations of empirical culture and history are possible [an impossible that makes Possible?]

OOG.content: for Plato, wasn’t the eternity of essences another name for nonempirical historicity?
OOG.linkedContent: for Plato, wasn’t the eternity of essences another name for nonempirical historicity?

OOG.content: Europe is the good example of historicity, incarnating in its purity the Telos of all historicity: universality, omnitemporality, infinite traditonality
OOG.linkedContent: Europe is the good example of historicity, incarnating in its purity the Telos of all historicity: universality, omnitemporality, infinite traditonality

OOG.content: three heights of historicity in Husserl: 1) general sense, essence of human existence moves in spiritual space of culture or tradition 2) European culture, theoretical project, philosophy 3) “conversion of philosophy into phenomenology”
OOG.linkedContent: three heights of historicity in Husserl: 1) general sense, essence of human existence moves in spiritual space of culture or tradition 2) European culture, theoretical project, philosophy 3) “conversion of philosophy into phenomenology”

OOG.content: apriori structures of historicity could be questioned only by recourse to language, writing, the capacity of reactivation, and finally to method [this can be taken as Husserl’s method and as Derrida’s method]
OOG.linkedContent: apriori structures of historicity could be questioned only by recourse to language, writing, the capacity of reactivation, and finally to method [this can be taken as Husserl’s method and as Derrida’s method]

OOG.content: eidos of historicity, after Crisis, exceed limits assigned to it in Ideas I: absolute ideal Objectivity, this constituting history may be more profoundly constituted itself
OOG.linkedContent: eidos of historicity, after Crisis, exceed limits assigned to it in Ideas I: absolute ideal Objectivity, this constituting history may be more profoundly constituted itself

OOG.content: for Husserl, the origin of historicity will never be dependent on a history
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, the origin of historicity will never be dependent on a history

OOG.content: for Husserl, absolute is passage (historicity as passage of Speech, primordial Logos toward polar Telos)
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, absolute is passage (historicity as passage of Speech, primordial Logos toward polar Telos)

OOG.content: “method is not the neutral preface or perambulatory exercise of thought, rather, it is thought itself in the consciousness of its complete historicity”
OOG.linkedContent: “method is not the neutral preface or perambulatory exercise of thought, rather, it is thought itself in the consciousness of its complete historicity”

OOG.content: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense
OOG.linkedContent: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense

OOG.content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

OOG.content: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general
OOG.linkedContent: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general

FK.content: [historicity itself was an event] figure of Promised Land, essential bond btwn promise of place & historicity
FK.linkedContent: [historicity itself was an event] figure of Promised Land, essential bond btwn promise of place & historicity

FK.content: messianic or eschatological horizon delimits this historicity by having inaugurated it
FK.linkedContent: messianic or eschatological horizon delimits this historicity by having inaugurated it

BL.content: that which makes literature possible is outside literature
BL.linkedContent: that which makes literature possible is outside literature

BL.content: different periods of history of positive law give substance to literature, value of signatures [“authors”]
BL.linkedContent: different periods of history of positive law give substance to literature, value of signatures [“authors”]

AF.content: along with openness to future, via Yerushalmi,  Jew has historicity, obligation of memory, of the archive
AF.linkedContent: along with openness to future, via Yerushalmi, Jew has historicity, obligation of memory, of the archive

SPOM.content: a new thinking of historicity calls us beyond metaphysical concept of history and end of history, either Hegel’s or Marx’s
SPOM.linkedContent: a new thinking of historicity calls us beyond metaphysical concept of history and end of history, either Hegel’s or Marx’s

SPOM.content: instead of reading Kòjeve’s end of history like Fukuyama, as capitalist paradise, Derrida reads an actor’s ploy, a demand that corresponds to law of law: where history comes to an end, historicity of history beings, finally has chance of promising itself
SPOM.linkedContent: instead of reading Kòjeve’s end of history like Fukuyama, as capitalist paradise, Derrida reads an actor’s ploy, a demand that corresponds to law of law: where history comes to an end, historicity of history beings, finally has chance of promising itself

SPOM.content: where determined concept of man finished > là l’humanité pure de l’homme, de l’autre homme et de l’homme comme autre commence ou a enfin la chance de s’annoncer—de se promettre > in an inhuman or a-human fashion
SPOM.linkedContent: where determined concept of man finished > là l’humanité pure de l’homme, de l’autre homme et de l’homme comme autre commence ou a enfin la chance de s’annoncer—de se promettre > in an inhuman or a-human fashion

MPM.content: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this “fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history
MPM.linkedContent: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this “fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history

MPM.content: de Man: the incompatibility of grammar & meaning becomes explicit when linguistic structures are stated in political terms [on the grammar, historicity of law]
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: the incompatibility of grammar & meaning becomes explicit when linguistic structures are stated in political terms [on the grammar, historicity of law]

FWT.content: by inventing/violating modality of as if, revealing its infinity, literature endlessly opens up to historicity of political, w/ certain concept of democracy-to-come ——as if an increased responsibility in absolute freedom of literature
FWT.linkedContent: by inventing/violating modality of as if, revealing its infinity, literature endlessly opens up to historicity of political, w/ certain concept of democracy-to-come ——as if an increased responsibility in absolute freedom of literature

FWT.content: common possibilities of literature & democracy: 1) historicity (literature has acts, birthplaces, legacies; democracy defines itself by promising itself, by and in its historicity, its future-to-come) 2) power, credit of fiction [Montaigne/Pascal understood connection btwn right & fiction]
FWT.linkedContent: common possibilities of literature & democracy: 1) historicity (literature has acts, birthplaces, legacies; democracy defines itself by promising itself, by and in its historicity, its future-to-come) 2) power, credit of fiction [Montaigne/Pascal understood connection btwn right & fiction]

POS.content: but what about historicity of history [Derrida will not simply enumerate histories like Socrates enumerates sciences, never asking about scientificity of science], but won’t historicity always demand an essence? ineluctable reappropriation of metaphysics, don’t we need to ask what is the “history” of “essence”?
POS.linkedContent: but what about historicity of history [Derrida will not simply enumerate histories like Socrates enumerates sciences, never asking about scientificity of science], but won’t historicity always demand an essence? ineluctable reappropriation of metaphysics, don’t we need to ask what is the “history” of “essence”?

P.content: judgment of beauty opens historicity, inaugural example w/out concept, and also free, spontaneous (nothing less historical [?])
P.linkedContent: judgment of beauty opens historicity, inaugural example w/out concept, and also free, spontaneous (nothing less historical [?])

ATIA.content: history, historicity, historicality, all part of auto-biography, auto-definition, auto-situation of man [re: Derrida’s hesitation to claim there’s been a historical turning point in relation btwn man and animal, figure of turning pout too genetic, biological, zoological]
ATIA.linkedContent: history, historicity, historicality, all part of auto-biography, auto-definition, auto-situation of man [re: Derrida’s hesitation to claim there’s been a historical turning point in relation btwn man and animal, figure of turning pout too genetic, biological, zoological]

ATIA.content: before fall, before institution of nakedness, Adam was a vegetarian, Cain too was a vegetarian: God’s preference in Abel, the beginning of historicity, goes against his original commandment, now he prefers sacrifice
ATIA.linkedContent: before fall, before institution of nakedness, Adam was a vegetarian, Cain too was a vegetarian: God’s preference in Abel, the beginning of historicity, goes against his original commandment, now he prefers sacrifice

GSP.content: faithful comprehension [“true positivism”] of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)
GSP.linkedContent: faithful comprehension [“true positivism”] of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)

GSP.content: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]
GSP.linkedContent: genetic description of ego prescribes task of a universal genetic phenomenology (a eidos of historicity) for Husserl, this is not a series of ruptures, revolutions, that tear open a previous finitude to lay bear a hidden infinity, giving voice to dynamis of silence > the ruptures are always already indicated [Telos] [Derrida wonders if this a metaphysical affirmation in a phenemonology]

PS.content: for Foucault, enigma of the same permits continuity of meaning in absoluteness of rupture btwn madness and work > this is a historical relationship; but, for Derrida, to determine position of question (in history) is to eliminate an unexpected thought of historicity from memory
PS.linkedContent: for Foucault, enigma of the same permits continuity of meaning in absoluteness of rupture btwn madness and work > this is a historical relationship; but, for Derrida, to determine position of question (in history) is to eliminate an unexpected thought of historicity from memory

PS.content: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive

FS.content: the project of infinite tradition must be acknowledged as such: that it can always fail is the mark of its pure finitude/pure historicity
FS.linkedContent: the project of infinite tradition must be acknowledged as such: that it can always fail is the mark of its pure finitude/pure historicity

FS.content: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself
FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself

CHM.content: if great division btwn madness/Cogito is the historicity of history, could we write the history of historicity (the origin of history)? wouldn’t the hysteron proteron be more than a “logical fallacy”?
CHM.linkedContent: if great division btwn madness/Cogito is the historicity of history, could we write the history of historicity (the origin of history)? wouldn’t the hysteron proteron be more than a “logical fallacy”?

CHM.content: if historicity is proper to reason: history of reason is not history of its origin but one of its determined figures
CHM.linkedContent: if historicity is proper to reason: history of reason is not history of its origin but one of its determined figures

CHM.content: historicity: neither ahistorical eternity, nor empirically determined moment of history of facts
CHM.linkedContent: historicity: neither ahistorical eternity, nor empirically determined moment of history of facts

CHM.content: speech, confined to temporal rhythm of crisis & reawakening [re: Cogito as madness, then against madness] opens discourse by making a mockery, humiliating madman w/in us: movement of temporalization, historicity in general, reign of finite thought must stay close to this violence to liberate and live as speech > madman as fool of logos, of father, king, master
CHM.linkedContent: speech, confined to temporal rhythm of crisis & reawakening [re: Cogito as madness, then against madness] opens discourse by making a mockery, humiliating madman w/in us: movement of temporalization, historicity in general, reign of finite thought must stay close to this violence to liberate and live as speech > madman as fool of logos, of father, king, master

EJQB.content: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality
EJQB.linkedContent: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality

EJQB.content: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity

AFR.content: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]

TN.content: anthropocentric privilege fails to consider: 1) ultimate reduction of world 2) anything that’s not “human flesh,” i.e. technical prostheses 3) historicity that produces-human-beings-and-technics 4) that privileging human frees path toward Christian body
TN.linkedContent: anthropocentric privilege fails to consider: 1) ultimate reduction of world 2) anything that’s not “human flesh,” i.e. technical prostheses 3) historicity that produces-human-beings-and-technics 4) that privileging human frees path toward Christian body

TN.content: Chrétian’s carnal figure of a spiritual touch, conversion of body (becoming-flesh) marked by historical event of revelation (Christian body): Incarnation, the Eucharist, by the giving, announcing, promising, and memory of Hoc est meum corpus
TN.linkedContent: Chrétian’s carnal figure of a spiritual touch, conversion of body (becoming-flesh) marked by historical event of revelation (Christian body): Incarnation, the Eucharist, by the giving, announcing, promising, and memory of Hoc est meum corpus

TN.content: no denial in Chrétian of body’s historicity: no abstract historicity w/out a history of touch, no essential archefacticity [Franck’s flesh?]; no thinking (Heidegger’s) of Offenbarkeit more originary than Offenbarung
TN.linkedContent: no denial in Chrétian of body’s historicity: no abstract historicity w/out a history of touch, no essential archefacticity [Franck’s flesh?]; no thinking (Heidegger’s) of Offenbarkeit more originary than Offenbarung

TN.content: Christian body as post-sin, post-Incarnation historical body

AD.content: Levinas’ structural or a priori messiancity: fraternity, humanity, hospitality (not ahistorical but historicity w/out empirically determinable incarnation)
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ structural or a priori messiancity: fraternity, humanity, hospitality (not ahistorical but historicity w/out empirically determinable incarnation)

OG.content: the science of writing born in period of world’s history, look for roots of scientificity, roots of historicity, thus science of possibility of science, history of history, a grammatics not logic?
OG.linkedContent: the science of writing born in period of world’s history, look for roots of scientificity, roots of historicity, thus science of possibility of science, history of history, a grammatics not logic?

OG.content: how Saussure’s concept of the arbitrary strictly divides the uncertain frontiers btwn ideographic, pictographic, & phonetic scripts > arbitrariness appeals to opposition physis/nomos, physis/techné, whose ultimate function is perhaps to derive historicity
OG.linkedContent: how Saussure’s concept of the arbitrary strictly divides the uncertain frontiers btwn ideographic, pictographic, & phonetic scripts > arbitrariness appeals to opposition physis/nomos, physis/techné, whose ultimate function is perhaps to derive historicity

OG.content: writing as criterion of historicity or cultural value
OG.linkedContent: writing as criterion of historicity or cultural value

OG.content: perverse substitution as historicity itself or as degradation w/in history? doesn’t the former imply the latter? doesn’t concept supplement permit both interpretations?
OG.linkedContent: perverse substitution as historicity itself or as degradation w/in history? doesn’t the former imply the latter? doesn’t concept supplement permit both interpretations?

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] history also protects/resists abyss of evil > “moral love” (which is immoral, acc. Rousseau) becomes modesty (true morality of women)
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] history also protects/resists abyss of evil > “moral love” (which is immoral, acc. Rousseau) becomes modesty (true morality of women)
